tool_description: The API returns the number of days,  hours, working days, working hours, wages, weekend days, and the list of public holidays of the requested date period and country. You can also add any number of working days or working hours to a given date. 52 countries and over 270 regional calendars are currently supported and we work hard to keep our database up to date by following government announcements regarding public holidays changes. All the calendars can be fully customized from our friendly ...
name: Working days
title: Working days

api_list.name: /1.3/analyse
api_list.description: Analyse a period (you provide a start_date and an end_date over a given calendar, we respond with the period analysis)

required_parameters.name: country_code
required_parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

required_parameters.name: end_date
required_parameters.description: The end date (YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name or code of the preestablished configuration to use, typically, a regional calendar. See available countries & configurations

optional_parameters.name: end_time
optional_parameters.description: The end date's time (24 hours format, like 09:00 or 15:00, but not 3pm).If omitted, default value is 23:59.

optional_parameters.name: holiday_language
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the language in which the names of public holidays are presented (ISO 639-1, 2 letters code). This optional parameter is beneficial when querying a country with multiple official languages. Refer to the list of supported languages for more details. If this parameter is not specified, the default language used will be the primary official language of the queried country.

optional_parameters.name: start_time
optional_parameters.description: The start date's time (24 hours format, like 09:00 or 15:00, but not 3pm).If omitted, default value is 00:00

optional_parameters.name: profile_id
optional_parameters.description: If you want to query a customized calendar, provide its profile_id (6 caracters)

api_list.name: /1.3/get_array_info_day
api_list.description: Get detailed period information as an array of days

optional_parameters.name: holiday_language
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the language in which the names of public holidays are presented (ISO 639-1, 2 letters code). This optional parameter is beneficial when querying a country with multiple official languages. Refer to the list of supported languages for more details. If this parameter is not specified, the default language used will be the primary official language of the queried country.

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name or code of the preestablished configuration to use, typically, a regional calendar. See available countries & configurations

optional_parameters.name: profile_id
optional_parameters.description: If you want to query a customized calendar, provide its profile_id (6 caracters)

api_list.name: /1.3/add_working_hours
api_list.description: Add an amount of working time to a given start date/time

required_parameters.name: increment_time
required_parameters.description: The amount of working time to be added (or removed) to the start date time. Format H:i. This amount cannot exceed 5000 hours. For example, to add one hour: 1:00. To add 30 hours and 15 minutes: 30:15.  To remove 45 minutes: -0:45

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

required_parameters.name: country_code
required_parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

required_parameters.name: start_time
required_parameters.description: The start time in a 24 hours format with leading zeros.

optional_parameters.name: profile_id
optional_parameters.description: If you want to query a customized calendar, provide its profile_id (6 caracters)

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name or code of the preestablished configuration to use, typically, a regional calendar. See available countries & configurations

api_list.name: /1.3/define_custom_period
api_list.description: Defining a custom period (typically days of vacations of an employee or days of annual closure of a company) can be done from the working days websites user interface but can also be done programmatically from the API. A typical use case would be to retrieve the vacations of the workers out of the human ressources software and insert them into a custom calendar, then being able to query available working days.

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.description: A textual description of the custom period (up to 30 caracters)

required_parameters.name: profile_id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the calendar we are customizing.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: The color of custom period when displayed on the calendar. Colors can be useful in order to classify custom periods. Default value is orange.

optional_parameters.name: start_morning
optional_parameters.description: Does the custom period starts in the morning of the start_date? Default value is true. (This parameter can be used if you want to create half day custom periods.)

optional_parameters.name: end_afternoon
optional_parameters.description: Does the custom period ends in the afternoon of the end_date? Default value is true. (This parameter can be used if you want to create half day custom periods.)

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD) If omitted, end date will be equal to start date (one day custom period)

api_list.name: /1.3/delete_custom_period
api_list.description: Removing a previously defined custom period

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD)

required_parameters.name: profile_id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the calendar we are customizing.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD) If omitted, end date will be equal to start date (one day custom period)

api_list.name: /1.3/list_non_working_days
api_list.description: List the non working days (weekend days, public holidays and custom dates) between two dates in chronlogical order.

required_parameters.name: end_date
required_parameters.description: The end date (YYYY-MM-DD)

required_parameters.name: country_code
required_parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: holiday_language
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the language in which the names of public holidays are presented (ISO 639-1, 2 letters code). This optional parameter is beneficial when querying a country with multiple official languages. Refer to the list of supported languages for more details. If this parameter is not specified, the default language used will be the primary official language of the queried country.

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name or code of the preestablished configuration to use, typically, a regional calendar. See available countries & configurations

api_list.name: /1.3/add_working_days
api_list.description: Add (or remove) any number of working days to a date.

required_parameters.name: increment
required_parameters.description: The number of working days you want to add to your start date (positive or negative integer but not zero)

required_parameters.name: country_code
required_parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

optional_parameters.name: holiday_language
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the language in which the names of public holidays are presented (ISO 639-1, 2 letters code). This optional parameter is beneficial when querying a country with multiple official languages. Refer to the list of supported languages for more details. If this parameter is not specified, the default language used will be the primary official language of the queried country.

optional_parameters.name: include_start
optional_parameters.description: Should the count include the start_date? Default value is true. If you set include_start to false (\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"false\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"0\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"), the count will start at the next working day (or previous working day, if increment is negative)

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name or code of the preestablished configuration to use, typically, a regional calendar. See available countries & configurations

optional_parameters.name: profile_id
optional_parameters.description: If you want to query a customized calendar, provide its profile_id (6 caracters)

api_list.name: /1.3/get_info_day
api_list.description: Get detailed information about a specific day.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: The date to analyze (YYYY-MM-DD)

required_parameters.name: country_code
required_parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

optional_parameters.name: configuration
optional_parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

optional_parameters.name: profile_id
optional_parameters.description: If you want to query a customized calendar, provide its profile_id (6 caracters)

optional_parameters.name: holiday_language
optional_parameters.description: Specifies the language in which the names of public holidays are presented (ISO 639-1, 2 letters code). This optional parameter is beneficial when querying a country with multiple official languages. Refer to the list of supported languages for more details. If this parameter is not specified, the default language used will be the primary official language of the queried country.
